title: Mount Stuart (Queensland)
text:
Mount Stuart is a mountain in the locality of <a href="Mount%20Stuart%2C%20Queensland">Mount Stuart</a> in the City of Townsville, <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a>, Australia. It overlooks <a href="Townsville">Townsville</a> with an elevation of 584 metres.
It was named for <a href="Clarendon%20Stuart">Clarendon Stuart</a> (1833–1912), from 1859 Townsville's first district surveyor.
Mount Stuart is used for commercial and <a href="ABC%20Queensland">ABC Queensland</a> <a href="television">television</a> transmission, it was also used as a <a href="Bureau%20of%20Meteorology">Bureau of Meteorology</a> <a href="radar">radar</a> station until late 2011, where it was moved to Hervey Range.
Mount Stuart overlooks Townsville's <a href="Lavarack%20Barracks">Lavarack Barracks</a> a major military base, which consists of <a href="1%20RAR">1 RAR</a>, <a href="2%20RAR">2 RAR</a>, <a href="3%20RAR">3 RAR</a>, 2 CAV, 3/4 CAV, 3 CER, 1 MP Bn, 3 CSSB amongst others.
Mount Stuart is a popular outdoor recreational area, including trail running, mountain biking and rock climbing. The lookout at the top can be accessed via Mount Stuart Road from Stuart Drive in <a href="Roseneath%2C%20Queensland">Roseneath</a>.
